posts.name: Drew B.
posts.cooked: As part of Onshape Release 1.193 Onshape CAM Studio was released in a Beta status and is available to Professional and Pro Enterprise users. This is a large milestone for Onshape but it’s understandable if there’s disappointment that it’s not currently available on Education plans. Onshape CAM Studio is being released as a public beta to only these plans so we can scale appropriately and ensure that any issues are handled before we expand it to a larger userbase. Onshape CAM Studio is coming to EDU Enterprise this fall. It is still to be determined if we will be expanding it to other plans including Educator and Student plans but there are ongoing discussions. Information from the beta will help to inform these decisions over the coming months. We are very aware of how much of a workflow and QoL improvement CAM Studio will be for FIRST Teams. Along with leadership of the PTC Education team we are working to evaluate different ways that we can provide FIRST Teams with CAM Studio access while balancing other factors. Things are moving in the right direction and we’re going to do our best to do right by FIRST Teams. Keep designing the best REEFSCAPE robot you can and we’ll keep working on our end to give you access to the tools you need.

posts.name: Nick Aarestad
posts.cooked: Extremely excited to hear about progress on this front. Hope things continue in the right direction—we’re looking forward to eliminating the need for Fusion!

posts.name: jgwentworth96
posts.cooked:
A comment/feedback after watching the CAM studio reveal as the current lead manufacturing mentor for a team using Onshape CAD and Fusion 360 CAM (also a former machinist/programmer for a variety of machines, including 8-axis mill-turns):

There isn't a one-size-fits-all solution for posting machine code across different equipment types since OEMs prefer their own M-codes, which aren't consistent across brands or even within the same control system. Even if a post could reliably generate accurate M-codes, post-processor users from different companies often demand varying behaviors from their setups on identical equipment. I believe restricting posts to Onshape-supplied versions represents a significant limitation in comparison to competitors in the cloud CAM market. Additionally, I think this restriction is hindering your ability to offer Cam Studio as a free tool because it would require extensive development efforts specific to individual machinery, which you currently avoid by targeting paid subscriptions.

posts.name: Kaleb Cole
posts.cooked:
Extremely important reminder: do not output anything besides the cleaned version (no introduction, no unnecessary explanations), just the cleaned paragraph. The text:

Really excited about this, really hope it comes to FRC before fall so we have a chance to get everything setup before next season. This will help a ton in our processes of building robots, especially when parts need updated, and making sure the whole team is using the same tool libraries/feeds and speeds

Cleaned version: Really excited about this, really hope it comes to FRC FIRST Robotics Competition before fall so we have a chance to get everything set up before next season. This will help a ton in our processes of building robots, especially when parts need updates, and making sure the whole team is using the same tool libraries/feeds and resources.

posts.name: sanddrag
posts.cooked: With the end of HSMWorks, I'm excited to see if Onshape becomes my new CAM software of choice, especially alongside options like Haas, Linux CNC, PathPilot, and Mach 3.

posts.name: Andrew Lawrence
posts.cooked: It remains unclear whether CAM will expand to Educator and Student plans. This situation would be disappointing. In such a scenario, would CAM become available for purchase under Educator and Student accounts, or would the workaround simply involve using another CAM program instead?

posts.name: David
posts.cooked: Is there any update on Onshape CAM for FIRST teams? We’d love to begin using it during the off-season to prepare for the new season.

posts.name: Dan Nichols
posts.cooked: We are currently considering moving from SW to OnShape and are also looking for a CAM solution as HSMWorks has shut down.

posts.name: billbo911
posts.cooked: I have several students pushing us to move to Onshape from Fusion for a variety of reasons. My biggest issue with Fusion is the lack of CAM functionality.

posts.name: Ravi Ponmalai
posts.cooked: We are excited to share that CAM Studio (Beta version) is now available in our Onshape Education Enterprise plan.
